As soon as my mother stepped in the elevator it fell one and a half stories towards the basement with my mother barely getting in without being crushed to death or losing a limb. We pressed the call button to get help and the guest services employee said they were calling the elevator manufacturer to come get us out. This elevator had no air conditioning or ventilation in July and we were trapped with the door closed. After waiting about 45 minutes the heat was unbearable. We called the desk again and were told the same thing. We finally called 911 because we were drenched through our clothing in sweat and had another French family on with us with 2 small children who were very upset. FDNY came to pull us out after over an hour and were shocked at the heat coming out of the elevator when they opened the door. When I told the front desk person we wanted to be moved to a lower room because we were traumatized by the incident they agreed to move us to the 2nd floor the next day. When we got back from a day in the city the next evening, we packed out things to move to the lower floor. Once we got to the new room, it was not even ready for guests, with linens stripped from the beds, cleaning supplies strewn about everywhere, and a stench of ammonia so strong it burned our throats. I went back to the front desk and he said housekeeping was gone and he could only give us sheets and blankets to make the room ourselves, which I was not even considering doing. With no help from him we moved back to our previous room and unpacked yet again. After all of this trouble we were sick of moving our things around and waiting 30 minutes for the only working elevator. We didn’t receive so much as an apology from the hotel management for this nightmare of a hotel stay. I feel like we should have been compensated in some kind of way or at least apologized to for the trauma and trouble we endured at this hotel.

title: Pessimo servizio
text: Una stella solo per l'ottima posizione.  Personale della reception pessima, non aiutano, abbiamo chiesto x due giorni consecutivi l'asciugacapelli, alla fine dopo diversi solleciti ci hanno consegnato uno che non funziona nemmeno. Non parliamo della colazione 2 mele e qualche yogurt, se arrivi verso la fine non trovi nemmeno quei pochi cornetti che mettono a disposizione. Inoltre la colazione viene servita nella hall dell'albergo, che è piccolissima, dove ci vanno al massimo una ventina di persone, con un hotel di 22 piani  rischi di fare colazione in piedi. Evitatelo, se per caso vi viene proposto da qualche agenzia di viaggio, chiedete di cambiarlo. P.s. la pulizia delle stanze e il cambio delle asciugamani deve essere richiesto.

title: Buona posizione, letti comodi e buon prezzo.. per il resto lasciamo perdere 👎
text:
Come si può capire dal titolo la posizione è buona, sia per la vicinanza della metro che per la vicinanza a Times Square.
Il personale è gentile, ad eccezione della ragazza alla reception che non ha saputo (voluto) aiutarci con un problema all'aria condizionata, risolto il giorno successivo, grazie ad un altro collega che ha mandato velocemente un tecnico.
La colazione è scarsa, senza la parte salata, e la parte dolce consiste in due tipi di brioche (vuota e con burro), oltre al solo caffè americano, qualche mela insipida e succhi all'arancia. La colazione si svolge all'ingresso, che è anche la reception (su 20 piani di hotel, ci sono solo 15/16 posti a sedere...).
Le camere sono carine e abbastanza spaziose ed i letti molto comodi, anche se la camera non è mai stata pulita e gli asciugamani non sono stati mai cambiati in 6 giorni. Inoltre, le finestre non si possono aprire perché bloccate.
Detto ciò, non credo che torneremo in questo hotel e non lo consiglieremmo.

title: Good Location, Nice hotel and very friendly & accomodating staff!
text:
I love citadines connect! so glad i found them online, really worth the price! location is really good, very close to times square, rockefeller, and other tourists spots. The room is spacious for 3 adults and 1 child. The staff
are great, all so friendly and accomodating most especially francesca! Thank you so much for the warm welcome and great service! we will book your hotel again next time we visit NYC. :)

title: Ms
text:
The hotel is in a great location. The staff was very good and welcoming. The room was comfortable and we loved the breakfast option. We want to especially thank Ivan for the excellent service we received from him. 
We will definitely come back.

title: Ottima posizione
text: L'albergo gode di una posizione strategica. La pulizia della camera e il cambio asciugamani deve essere richiesto ma non abbiamo avuto problemi al riguardo. Articoli da toeletta e phon disponibili. Cabina doccia spaziosa. Camera dotata di cassaforte, macchina per il caffé e tv. Tessera magnetica per entrare nelle camere e dopo le 23. Colazione non abbondante e croissant senza arte né parte ma sufficiente come "aiutino" per arrivare alla seconda. Personale disponibile e gentile. Deposito bagagli purtroppo a pagamento. Tre valigie per dieci dollari. Aria condizionata un pò rumorosa. Nel complesso ci tornerei, sia per il prezzo che, soprattutto, per la centralità.

title: Excellent location
text: Not far from MTA, rail, and bus stops, and not far from Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, and multiple 5th Ave shopping sites. The rooms were clean, the service people were polite. Overall, great stay!

title: citadines stay
text: we had a great vacation, location is one of the best place to stay when in manhattan, francesca was very helpful and friendly ,we will surely comeback to stay her at citadines whenever we are in manhattan

title: Alex is the man!!!
text: You really have a gem with Alex there. He really went above and beyond when checking me and my roommate in. He really made us feel like we were important. I really appreciate the amazing service he provided. We had an awful day, our original hotel reservation at another place was cancelled we booked here last min and he was more than accommodating

title: Reservation cancellation within 24 hrs notice
text: Although a reservation was made months in advance and confirmation of our stay was made days ago, the hotel simply and deadly cancelled our reservation less than 24 hours of our arrival. What a shame! So TOTALLY disappointed, this is TOTALLY unacceptable. I will NEVER book this hotel again, EVER. .

title: Andrejka
text:
For bussines purposes great stay, breakfast was basically fruit and some sweet packed bagel at the reception counter.
But great location and clean rooms.!
Super great management and reception desk employees.
Thank you!

title: Great Hotel
text: When checking in and I got to my room the AC did not work , I went down to the front desk and they called maintenance up to my room to fix it , they showed up in less then 10 minutes, it could not be fixed I was given another room , I was happy with my stay there hotel was clean , service was very prompt when I asked for more towels , staff was friendly I definitely will stay there again

title: Modern, small but cosy hotel! Perfect location!
text: I highly rated this hotel - it was modern, clean and perfect distance from everything you could need in NYC! Close walk to Times Square, Central Park and 47-50 Rockfeller Centre Station! The aircon worked absolutely fine and the hotel felt safe & secure. WIFI was great too. The downside’s was the breakfast, they only offered yoghurts, a few croissants & bananas/apples. For the money you spend they could definitely provide cereal at least! Also we requested for our room to be cleaned twice and this was forgotten about TWICE. Although they did accommodate and let us leave our luggage free of charge after check out as our flight was after 11am. Apart from that, I do recommend you book this hotel for a modern, cosy and prime location trip!

title: Top Lage, mit großem Verbesserungsbedarf
text:
Pros:
Die Lage des Hotels ist wirklich top. Alle wichtigen U-Bahnen sind in Gehweite, weshalb es für Sightseeing in New York optimal ist. Das Hotelzimmer war sauber und relativ klein, aber ausreichend groß, da wir ohnehin nur zum Schlafen im Zimmer waren.

Cons:
-) Hellhörige Zimmer. Speziell das zufallen von anderen Zimmertüren hört man extrem gut.
-) Fehlalarm der Brandmeldeanlage. Wir mehrmals (!) täglich (und auch nachts) Feueralarme. Das gepieste/gequietsche war ein Horror.
-) Die Klimaanlage im Zimmer ist schon sehr veraltet und dadurch recht laut. Schlafen ist bei eingeschaltener Klima nicht möglich. Bei 36C hält man es jedoch ohne Klima nicht mehr aus.
-) Frühstück: es besteht aus Topfengolatsche, Croissant, Joghurt, Banana, Apfel, Orangensaft, Kaffee und Tee. Und das täglich. Etwas abwechslungsreicheres Frühstück und zB Wasser wären sehr wünschenswert gewesen.

title: Oude kamers
text: Ligging is fantastisch. Maar kamers vervallen. Vieze gordijntjes en als je over pvc vloer liep sopte het water er tussen door vanuit de badkamer. Plafond lag er elke morgen op de vloer in de badkamer. Schoonmaken van de kamer moest je vragen en als je t vroeg gebeurde t niet. Gangen naar de kamer met vieze vloerbedekking en muffig. En ontbijt bestond alleen uit croissantjes en fruit. Ook niet echt behulpzame medewerkers. Voor het geld zeker geen aanrader !

title: Review of Citadines Connect Fifth Avenue New York
text: The thing I liked most in my stay at the Citadines was its convenient location. It was a few steps to the Fifth Avenue and walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Bldg and other tourist attractions including the Central Park. It also has courteous and very accommodating staff in the persons of Francesca and  Matthew.

title: Bon hotel
text:
Hôtel à la hauteur du service de la chaine Citadines.
A noter que le ménage n'est pas fait tout les jours, comme dans les autres Citadines (Londres par exemple) mais uniquement sur demande.
Le petit déjeuner est inclus, mais il vaut mieux remonter dans la chambre pour le prendre car l'espace au rez de chaussée est beaucoup trop petit, a moins d'accepter d'être debout, ce qui n'est pas très agréable (mieux vaut investir dans l'achat d'un plateau pour pouvoir remonter plus facilement ce que vous choisissez). Sinon il y a plusieurs "Diner" dans le quartier (The red diner en particulier).
Il faut payer $5 pour pouvoir faire garder les bagages en fin de séjour... première fois que je vois cela dans un hôtel, ce n'est pas cher, mais un peu bizarre, ce serait un hôtel à bas prix, je comprendrai, mais la chambre étant facturée à 330 euros par jour il pourrait s'abstenir de cette facturation.
L'équipe d'accueil est sympathique.

title: Could not find our reservation
text:
We booked through TripAdvisor Plus and had a confirmation and booking number. The hotel could not find our reservation and offered no assistance. We ended up going through TripAdvisor support where they contacted the hotel group, who only offered a 20% compensation for their error. Hotels were 300% more expensive than when we booked our reservation, and this was a wholly inadequate resolution. 

While we were in the lobby trying to figure out our rebooking, another group's reservation also could not be found.

Stay away from this place!

title: TERRIBLE SERVICE & STAFF
text:
Currently staying here for 4 nights and all we can say is the service has been horrific. Reception staff are in a world of their own and extremely forgetful and inattentive. 

You have to request housekeeping 24 hours in advance. We’ve done this twice so far and both times the order has not been put through - our room still has not been cleaned. 

There are no amenities - only moisturiser, shampoo and conditioner. Not even a vanity kit. 

There is no kettle - so no point buying tea bags. 

Walls are paper thin and the aircon is extremely loud. You can hear the lift arriving and anyone shutting their doors.  

Not an issue for us as we are conscious of the space in New York but fyi rooms are TINY if you have kids with you. 

Only benefit is the proximity to landmarks and central location. 

I’d rather pay more for better staff and service in the future.

title: Not What I Expected
text:
I made reservations here because I saw the reviews. I was disappointed with all the extra fees and the comfort of the beds. Also the "complimentary" breakfast was a huge disappointment. I think a Best Western would've been a better choice. My two teen daughters and I stayed at the Fairfield Inn Marriott the day before and I regretted not staying there for the rest of the trip. Only good thing about the Citadines Connect is probably the location. Walking distance to most things. 

There's no fridge in room, and only one of 3 ice machines works, and it's located on the 15th or 16th floor. The older male maintenance staff was helpful. After telling him about the machines, he went to get ice for me. 

Breakfast hours are from 6:30-9am; consist of stale croissants, stale danishes, almost room temperature yogurt, room temperature orange juice, coffee, hot tea, and bananas. We got breakfast by 7am, so the room temperature items should've still been cold. We stood from 5/6-5/9/22 and it was like that each morning. I didn't bother eating it after the second morning.

They charge a resort fee ($68.88) for no resort amenities. According to front desk, the amenities are newspaper, phone, breakfast, and WiFi. I can't see being charged for so much on the quality of these items.

They charge to hold your bags (even if it's only for 3 hours). They charge $5 for every 3 bags. So if you had 6 bags like us, we were charged $10 to hold 3 back packs and 3 roller bags, for 3 hours.

My linens smelled like a sweaty cologne man, I had to remove the pillow cases and sheet. It didn't seem sanitary.

I did like the bathroom. It was spacious. I did not like they only provided 2 towels. When I questioned for more, they were hesitant and stingy about it. One adult, and two teens, I don't know how only 2 towels are enough. Front desk seen what was reserved and the occupancy. Just be courteous and provide the items, simple.

TV did have cable and HBO, and the window in the room opened a couple of inches so it was nice to have a little fresh air in.

Beds were not comfortable, think it was the springs that you can feel.

It did come with a small safe and ironing board with iron.

Overall, this stay was average. There was nothing luxury or out of the ordinary with this hotel.

title: Hôtel sans confort et sale
text:
Nous sommes resté une semaine. 
Je ne recommande pas cet hôtel. 
Personnel aimable une fois sur deux 
Quand nous sommes arrivé chambre sale (café et jus d’orange sur le sol), dessus et dessous de lit et de meuble plein de poussière. Le ménage passe que si vous le demandez la veille y compris pour les serviettes. Rentabilité quand tu nous tiens. 
Petit déjeuner « inclu » avec pour seuls produits : croissant, jus d’orange, yaourt et c’est tout. Un verre d’eau est payant. Hôtel de 22 étages, 10 places assise pour pour le petit déjeuner. Inadmissible 
Chambre sans rangement, donnant sur une arrière cours avec odeur de graille et insalubrité (l’envers du décors) 
Couchage inconfortable avec lit de 140cm, pour deux adultes, aux États Unis. torticolis et mal de dos depuis 7 jours. 
Notre alarme incendie s’est allumée dans la nuit, nous avons relancé pendant 3 jours pour qu’on nous la remette et elle y est toujours pas (obligation et sécurité)
Bref, bon emplacement c’est certain mais la prochaine fois on prendra sûrement un peu plus éloigné mais de meilleure qualité et prestations.
Le business au détriment du service, pour hôtel c’est le comble.

title: Perfect Hotel
text: Chose this Citadines Connect hotel for its 528 Ft walking distance to the Philippine consulate for my nephew’s Jef Albea  1st Art exhibit here in NY. But my sister and I walked every where, it seems walking distance to wherever we wanted to go… Times Square, Broadway , St Patrick’s Church, Grand Central Station, Summit One Vanderbilt, Central Park, and so many restaurants and shops. Didn’t need UberEats OMG! Our room on the 20th floor has toilet with good flush system, has 2 very clean and comfortable beds, plenty of pillows for 2 double beds, steam iron , safe, nice shower, hair dryer, and Keurig coffeemaker which we didn’t use since there was free pastry/yogurt/apples and excellent fresh brewed coffee daily in the lobby 6-9 AM. Yes, there’s a TV with plenty of free channels. Yes, the room and bathroom is a little smaller than what we’ve had in the past but this is a little perfect hotel we will surely come back to. And the staff are so friendly and very helpful. This hotel is a keeper.

title: Excellent for short stay in NYC
text: Great location, walkable to sights, theatres, museums and parks.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  Room was small but ok for up to 3 people.  Bathroom was clean; good water pressure.  Not too much noise except you can hear people talking by the elevator.  The door did not close completely; had to slam shut.  Overall a good place to stay.

title: Cramped, unsuitable for families or anyone staying longer than one night
text:
Was gutted when we saw our room in this hotel.  The hotel very slim but has 21 floors.  These are serviced by 2 lifts and with only one family per lift allowed in due to covid you can imagine how long you needed to wait for an empty lift at times.  

Rooms were pokey with no storage for clothing.  

Bathroom was so small an adult had to sit on the toilet at an angle as the toilet was placed too close to the shower enclosure.  Crusty nose bogeys and someone else’s hair were found on the back of the bathroom door which was probably never cleaned because you’d be hard pushed to be standing in the bathroom and be able to close the door. 

Floor of the room was dirty and dusty even though we had requested our room to be cleaned twice during our stay (which has to be booked 24 hours in advance) Found something green and hairy growing on the floor under the heating/aircon unit.  Don’t think the carpet in the hallway which serviced the 6 rooms in our floor was hoovered at all during our 8 day visit. 

The room did have a mirror - however if you wanted to put your make up on you had to sit on the floor to do it. 

The room also had a coffee maker - however they give you paper cups and two sachets of coffee for your stay (luckily we know how hiddeous their tea is so we’d taken our own tea bags) asking for clean paper cups each day became laborious. 

And the kicker - having to pay the hotel to store your luggage on check out day (oh and they don’t accept cash for anything) 

I can’t even compare this to a hotel chain in the UK as I’ve stayed in small Holiday Inn/Travel Lodge rooms that were better than this and cost a LOT LESS money. 

This is a typical - one nighter kind of hotel where you can actually just check in for a quickie (4 hours was $120) 

NOT RECOMMENDED 

Photo 1: the storage facilities - no drawers to put anything. 6 coat hangers. Nowehere to store suitcase

Photo 2: dirt from supposedly freshly cleaned room 

Photo 3: underneath the heating unit

title: Excelente ubicación Excelente Staff
text:
Localizado a lo que es en verdad cuadras de Times Square, Citadines connect brinda excelentes ventajas a quienes se hospeden en el, desayuno "grab N go" (muy conveniente por los precios en Manhattan), un staff divino quienes hicieron de mi estadía una experiencia irrepetible, a pesar de estar localizado en un area ruidosa, nos permitió un excelente descanso para nuestros atareados días en NYC.

Cuando llegamos tuvimos un tema de check in, el cual es staff al ser lo mas comprensivo pudimos buenamente solucionar.

Espero que mis agradecimientos a Aliyah, Francesca, Jasmine, Stephanie y Ola sean recibidos y sean felicitados por su increíble amabilidad y atención al detalle.

title: Lovely stay
text: My mother and I recently had a 5 night stay at this hotel and would absolutely recommend it. It's a great location on a relatively quiet street, the rooms are a good size (for NYC), beds are comfortable, and the bathrooms are recently renovated. But what made a really big difference was the staff. They go above and beyond to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The few minor issues that came up were dealt with quickly and professionally. And everyone - from the cleaning people to the front desk - was always very welcoming with a special thanks to Jasmine and Alea.

title: Amazing stay in NYC for couples
text:
Love the ambience and customer service. Very near all the most famous attractions.  Will definitely come back next time I visit the city. Fully recommend to come visit and explore some more.

...
...
...

title: Amazing location and value
text: The location of this hotel is perfect for first time travelers to NYC. I stayed with my two best friends for 4 nights. The room has great space and it’s pretty comfortable. Everything was clean and the bathroom had nice water pressure. The beds were super comfortable. The breakfast is pretty basic so, take that into consideration. I will definitely stay here again!

title: Nice hotel for it’s prime location and the price.
text:
I stopped by here to spend a weekend in the heart of NYC with my wife. I really liked the hotel for it to be just 5 minutes of walk from the Time Square.
The hotel is very clean and the staff is friendly.
We met Lea and Francesca as our receptionist and they were very friendly and helpful for whatever we needed.

The hotel is not very luxury but I don’t mind as long as it’s neat and clean.

title: Great room, shabby lobby.
text: The lobby really needs a little lift, at least change the pillows and fix up some furnitures, they looked really worn out and defeated. We were checked in close midnight, half the lobby chairs are on the long table upside down, that gave me a shabby first impression, shouldn’t hotel in shape 24/7? The suit are in good size which turned my mood around. One ottoman is really dirty with marks on it, but the rest are okay. No good view, but the location is convenient. It’s still a comfortable stay. Like the room a lot!

title: Birthday week in NYC
text: Very very nice hotel. So close to everything. You still can find your Rest in the hotel. Room was very clean. And people kind. You are close to many shops on the 5th av. I'll go back there! ..........

title: Lovely and central
text:
Me and my partner stayed here from the 27th - 31st Jan. First impressions were great, reception area is lovely and cosy and the hotel is easily spotted from the street. 

The hotel is easily accessible from the subway stations and we actually used public transport to get from JFK to here. Very easily done. 

Check in was great; quick and easy which was brilliant after a long day travelling from the UK. 

Room is a good size and with everything we needed. Bathroom is nice and modern. Bed was extremely comfortable. The only thing we found interesting was that the room was not cleaned daily so now new towels, by the end of the stay our duvet was barely staying in the duvet cover. If we were staying longer we would of picked this up with reception but we figured maybe due to covid they were done daily?  

All staff were brilliant and friendly and our stay was very enjoyable. Super close to everything, central park is around a 15/20 minute walk away and Times Square is only 5 minutes. 

Would defo recommend this hotel as a base for anyone wanting to explore the city!! 

Thanks for a great stay.

title: Great location, amenities and staff.
text: My sister and I stayed at this great low noise location. Very comfortable for a NY hotel, affordable considering the proximity to 5th avenue. Have been told the up-and-go breakfast will be modified. Will stay again definitely next round!

title: Conveniently-located, modern and clean hotel
text: Modern and clean hotel a few steps away from the vibrant 5th Avenue. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Jasmine from the front desk was very attentive with the checkout process. I would recommend this property to both solo travellers and families. Definitely great value for money.

title: Great location!
text: Citadines Connect New York  is super well located just a few minutes walking to Bryant Park and Times Squares. The rooms are modern and very comfortable. The reception area is very cool and the staff is great!

title: NEW YORK 🗽
text: Posizione centralissima per le principali attrazioni, 5 minuti da Rockefeller centre , Gran Central station e Central Park . Vicina a fermate della metto. Camere piccole ma bene strutturate, snack e bevande in vendita in caso di bisogno. FRANCESCA la receptionist molto carina e simpatica.

title: Buena ubicación, sin servicio de limpieza
text:
Muy buena ubicación, muy cerca de time square y otros atractivos a través de conexiones, pero el servicio de limpieza a la habitación no existe
Imagínate estar 8 días y en ningún momento hicieron aseo, recogieron la basura, cambiaron toallas / sábanas. Tuvimos que pedir el servicio de limpieza, pero lo ofrecieron para el día en que nos íbamos !!!!!

title: Perfect Stay!
text: We decided to take our family of 5 on a last minute visit to NYC after Christmas. We needed two rooms and wanted to be in a central location, but we also needed it to be at an affordable price. After searching for hotels for several days, this one popped up as an option and at a great price...much lower than everything else for blocks around it. I was worried that it would be terrible, but it was just the opposite. It was clean,  newly remodeled in a simple modern decor, perfectly located for walking or the subway, and had very helpful and responsive staff.  We walked to Central Park, Macy's, Times Square, and rode the subway down to lower Manhattan and Greenwich Village. The street in front is not overly busy, but there is a Wendy's across the street, a Walgreens around the corner, and lots of local restaurants only feet from the front door.  Since we flew out on a late flight, the hotel allowed us to store our bags in a locked room for the day at a very minimal price.  Not all hotels offer this service. We felt safe and loved having such a pleasant place to return to after adventuring out into the city. We hope to be back soon!

title: Highly Recommended Stay While in NYC!
text: Fantastic! Stayed 2 nights. Rooms small but more than adequate. Enough space for a short stay, great location near excellent restaurants and best of NYC sights. Staff exceptionally friendly and helpful, even anticipating comfort needs. Room very clean.  Highly recommended!

title: Great location
text:
Great Hotel in a perfect location. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room for 3 of us was small but worked well. Bathroom was tiny.
Bed was comfortable. Had a room on the 3rd floor in the back. Very quiet no street noise. Wouldn’t call their breakfast a breakfast. Apple or banana with granola bars also prepackaged muffins and OJ No coffee except in room.

title: Just okay
text:
First of all…the lobby is locked until you are able to get a key card. The staff at the front desk repeatedly ignored us waiting at the door prior to Check-in.  We had to sneak in multiple times with other guests. We had requested a fridge (at a $25/per day fee) which was not in the room. No coffee maker in the room. No breakfast despite being advertised as a grab and go.  
They offer room service through a third party, Butler, which took over an hour and a half for coffee. Unbelievable. Never stay here.

title: Meglio scegliere altro
text:
Nonostante la posizione ottimale il risultato è pessimo. 
Allora, posizione ottima, comoda per Times Square, Bryant park, Broadway e gran central terminal. 
Stanza piccola, sporca, poco funzionale negli spazi. Riscaldamento rumoroso e che con una ridotta modulabilità lo rende fastidioso. 
Cambio biancheria a asciugamani a giorni alternati. Colazione nulla: una mela, una banana e dei muffin confezionati non mangiabili. 
Deposito bagagli a pagamento. Personale scortese, poco disponibile  poco attento. 
Insomma..andate altrove!

title: Perfeito, mas…
text:
O hotel é excelente. Localização fantástica, perto de tudo, tem um Starbucks literalmente em frente, funcionários simpáticos, atendimento rápido e eficiente, ambiente lindo e muito agradável. Hotel moderno, com aparência bem nova, claro, arejado.
Os quartos são de tamanho ótimo, o nosso tinha 2 camas duplas ( não muito grandes) mas a circulação era ótima, estávamos em 3 pessoas, com 3 malas mais mala de mão e não houve problema de espaço ou circulação. O banheiro também com tamanho bom, moderno, água quentinha, pressão do chuveiro muito boa. 
Circulação de pessoas bem tranquila. Quarto bem silencioso, o hotel seria perfeito mas… o ar condicionado é uma situação a parte. Não sei se era apenas o do nosso quarto, mas era algo impossível de se usar. O barulho era como uma britadeira dentro do quarto. Não havia forma de liga-ló para aquecer o quarto. Ainda bem que ainda não estava tão frio então conseguíamos desligar (o que na verdade não desligava totalmente, ele continuava funcionando emitindo ar frio) 
Não reclamamos porque só íamos passar 3 dias e optamos por não perder tempo com troca de quarto, porém num clima um pouco mais frio já seria complicado não ter o ar para aquecer. Pode ser que seja um problema pontual. 
Mas ainda assim acho que o hotel vale muito a pena e certamente escolheríamos ele outras vezes.

title: Birthday Holiday
text: We have just returned from a fantastic week in New York, our first visit but certainly not our last. When planning the holiday I was overwhelmed with the choice of hotels and almost have up but my husband persevered and chose Citadines Connect Fifth Avenue. It was perfect. The location is just fantastic and couldn’t have been better for our needs. The hotel ticked all the boxes as well. It was a no frills hotel but that was fine for us as all we required was a clean comfy room to sleep and we intende to spend our time exploring and not staying in our hotel bedroom. The room was clean, warm and the bed was extremely comfortable. We requested a bath tub when we booked and our wish was duly fulfilled. There was always plenty of hot water at any time - day or night. The “grab and go” breakfast also suited our requirements. We didn’t have much interaction with the staff dying our stay however when we did they were always extremely helpful and courteous. We would definitely recommend this hotel for your stay in New York and we will definitely stay again when, not if, we return.

title: Review for day-use room
text: Booked this place for the day to get some work done. Room is clean and quiet, but not good value. Most other hotels offer better rooms for day-use rate. This one only offers rooms on the ground, second and basement levels, so they’re dark and dismal. Wouldn’t come back.

title: Stay away— run
text:
Long lines to check in and they don’t care..  bags are crammed among three floors and took a hour to get.   The elevators are slow, hvac makes more noise than the traffic.. the ice cream truck at the corner keeps you awake all night….  

Front desk staff has zero personality and could honestly couldn’t care about anything.  One (Francesca) ran and paid a bill with 10 people in line to check in!!!! 

Breakfast ends before 9 am and is a rotten piece of fruit and stale muffin…

Oh and they allow late check out for a fee but they don’t have rooms ready for those who are ready to check in at 3 ready was over a hour wait

Pros- bed is decent- no tv issues- bathroom was nice…

title: Citadines Connect Fifth Avenue
text: Very nice hotel, clean and the staff is very friendly. The prices are pretty affordable for NYC on a holiday weekend..Francesca was very kind and super helpful. The hotel is very convenient and walking distance to almost all of the sites that you would want to see in NYC.

title: A Cozy and Comfortable Stay
text: New York hotel stays are largely noted for several things. One, you're not there for the room, but to explore the city. Two, you always want an inside room unless you enjoy the serenade of street sounds all night long. Three, you seek safety, comfort, and thick walls blocking neighbors' laughter or TV time. This hotel succeeds, and was a very pleasant stay. First, the location is unbeatable -- a short walk to Grand Central and Times Square, with easy access to Central Park, Bryant Park and Subways to Queens. Second, a 21st floor inside room offered ample space between neighboring buildings and minimal street noise. The lift wasn't a problem as was the case at other mid-range New York hotels in Midtown in past visits. Second, the cozy room has modern furniture and the tight space is appointed appropriately. Yes, we had some minor issues with a broken toilet seat, but maintenance quickly fixed it. The Bigelow bath products are a plus, as is the modern bath -- something still not found in similarly priced, and aged, hotels. Lastly, you cannot beat Francesca and the front desk staff for their professionalism and "we care" attitude. This was a very welcomed change from other NYC stays. My wife accompanied me for what was to be a business trip. I worked. She played tourist. And, our stay was one that made us want to come back in a few weeks! Great job Ascott on a lovely stay. We understand the lack of coffee in the lobby, but we recommend Matto a block north or the coffee house en route to Grand Central :)

title: Philippine Consulate
text: My wife and I stayed for a couple of nights and we had such a pleasant visit. After driving for 6 hours, it was very refreshing to have been greeted by a very nice Filipina at the front desk. Francesca was very helpful and made the check in process enjoyable. Will definitely stay here again. 🤘🏼🇵🇭

title: Best Hotel/Air Bnb hospitality
text: From the moment we booked to the moment we checked out, Francesca from the front desk was the absolute best. The place was clean, spacious and the location was perfect. On top of that, the staff was so friendly and super hospitable. We loved our stay! I would definitely stay there again every time I visit NYC. The place was quite convenient, from restaurants right outside to coffee shops close by. It is the perfect place to stay for a great time in New York

title: very loud, painfully slow elevators, no coffee, not as advertised
text: I was extremely disappointed with my stay. First, DO NOT allow the hotel to put you in a room on the first floor. The room is next to the lobby and you end up listening to loads of people talking and rolling luggage ALL NIGHT AND MORNING. Number 2, despite the fact that the room is advertised to have a coffee machine, it does not. When I asked for one I was told "they were out of machines." WHAT? The next day my room was moved to the 17th floor and I was grateful. The walls are still paper-thin and the elevator is impossibly slow. This time I did have a coffee maker (yay) however it seems you either get a coffee maker or a phone, not both. Plus there's no housekeeping so your coffee doesn't get replaced. The "breakfast" is a basketful of granola bars and apples. did give it one extra star for cleanliness. It is clean. But it is ABSOLUTELY NOT WORTH IT.

title: Pésimo hotel
text:
El peor hotel!!!! Nunca te limpian las habitaciones y la encargada de front desk es una inútil!!!
El ruido de los cuartos es insoportable y su "desayuno" mejor que se lo ahorren porque además te debes levantar a las 8am si quieres que te toque

title: Friendly staff, Clean hotel
text:
The hotel staffs are very friendly and accommodating, especially Francesca who really helped me even before I got there. It was my first solo trip to NY but knowing someone is there to assist anytime makes me feel less worried. 

The hotel is clean and very close to a lot of businesses & establishments. I went to the Philippine Consulate to renew my passport and it was just a 2-minute walk away.

-Tina A.

title: Citadines new york
text:
Wonderful hotel, clean and nice, the staff is so polite and helpful, especially Francesca who help us in everything in our stay.
Rooms are clean, new and has a lot of things, modern design also.
The hotel located at 45th street between 5th and 6th avenue. Close to times square as well

title: Citadines Connect - Great Stay
text: Francesca was very nice, comforting to see a fellow Filipino greet us :) The stay was  great and the staff were very supportive. Prime location to visit NYC's hot spots as well. Would come back just for the great company alone.

title: Vacaciones en Manhattan
text:
Excelente atención, habitaciones amplias,, silenciosas camas muy cómodas y baños muy lindos. Ubicación inmejorable. La atención del personal muy amable y cordial. Gracias a Francesca.

Muy recomendable.

title: Comfortable
text:
It was really nice to stay here
The hotel is clean
It’s close to time square, and subway station.
The staffs are friendly.
Thank you amanda for helping us while we’re staying in nyc
We would love to come back and stay here for our next vacation.

title: Honeymoon
text: Great hotel. We stayed in for 2 nights and had an amazing time. The hotel has a good location (close to Times Square....5 min walk) , was well kept and clean. Staff was extremely nice to us especiallyFrancesca who was a sweetheart ❤. I really recommend this hotel as it could be a tough choice to choose a hotel in New York.

title: Amazing
text: El hotel tiene muy buena atención por parte de las recepcionistas, especialmente Francesca, una persona muy amable, también completamente atenta con sus servicios fue amigable y en ningún momento hubo dificultad para comunicarse con ella, un excelente servicio.

title: Vacaciones
text: En hotel tiene muy buen servicio tiene un excelente ubicación para conocer todos los sitios de interés de la ciudad de New York, las habitaciones son de suficiente espacio apenas para lo que las necesitas.

title: Great Customer Service
text: Even though the hotel room was too small the service we received from Stephanie and Amanda were amazing. They both were very friendly and helpful any time we needed something they were always willing to help. Ten starts for the both of them.

title: PERFECTO ..!! en Atención, calidad y Ubicación
text:
Me encantó la ubicación del hotel, está en una área segura para caminar y todo aboslutamente todo queda cerca, Time Square, Iglesia de San Patrick, Central Park,  todas las tiendas más famosas, restaurantes, las paradas y estaciones para el bus turístico, para tomar el tren, en fin ideal para todos los gustos, si vas de compras, si vas de diversión, por hacer turismo o lo que sea, muy recomendado.
La atención es excelente, te reciben con una amplia sonrisa y hablan inglés, español. Me ayudaron a coordinar un transfer al aeropuerto o pedir comida a la habitación.
Las habitaciones son super silenciosas y muy cómodas para un buen descanso.

title: Super Friendly, Comfortable and Great Price. Highly Recommended.
text: Definitely one of our best stays in New York City. Everything was easy including the check in and the checkout. Joe, Stephanie and the team were extremely helpful and always friendly. Rooms were cozy and quiet.Located walking distance to a lot of NYC. Highly recommended.

title: Exceptional customer care
text:
Francesca provided the BEST customer care that we have ever experienced. I chose the word « care » over commonly used « service » to show how wonderful she was. From the moment we walked in, Francesca was so friendly, resourceful and fulfilled our requests with undivided attention and a genuine smile. 

On our check out day, she extended some time to my family members for their convenience. We were also given rooms right next to each other on our arrivals from different States. 

Francesca made us feel so valued and it was such a pleasure to stay there!

It is a very safe Hotel with control access from the main entrance, only current guests with a magnetic door key can enter. 

Bedding and towels are crispy clean, completed with very nice flagrant toiletries. 

On a less positive note, we would like to mention how loud the A/C was and the unreliable wifi connection. The complimentary breakfast could also be improved with oatmeal or cereal. 

Overall we would strongly recommend Citadines Connect Fifth Avenue Hotel, especially with Francesca’s personalized assistance. 

Thank you again for a wonderful stay in NYC!

title: Lugar agradable
text:
Era nuestra primera vez en NY y en realidad quedamos muy encantados con lo céntrico que queda el Hotel y el acceso a todos los puntos.
Es muy lindo y agradable tal como lo vez en las fotos.
La estancia se hizo más simpática aún por las chicas del front desk: Francesca con quien hablábamos incluso antes de llegar para hacer consultas, Stephanie y Amanda quienes siempre nos ayudaron.
Nos vamos felices  y con ganas de volver.

title: Best location at a reasonable price
text: One of the best location if you're looking for an affordable hotel. It is near Time square, Bryant Park, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Central Park.. and so on. Francesca, the Front Desk Agent, is very helpful. Will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

title: Till you check out...then the drama starts..
text:
.... left phone notes for the manager... sending out emails but without any success, 
working on refund but seems to be very hard 5 weeks further.  
Double booking was paid I had to bring it up
Regular refund not received back should be after 5- 10 working days..
Pending 5 weeks now.  Last 2 emails un replied for over a week.
its not ok to chase a reservations department for so long. 
waiting on a reply and solution

title: Biosecurity
text: The biosecurity protocols were not met. Most of the hotel personnel never wore a face mask. Not even when speaking to customers at the reception. Room cleanliness was very mediocre. Cleaning ladies never wore their face masks appropriately . Mattresses seem to be old and sagging. There are sinking spots on them. What we really liked was its location.

title: Pursuit of good food.
text: Came to New York to see what's changed and taste what's new. Conveniently located a few blocks away from Grand Central and across the street from both Wendy's and Starbucks. Although small, the rooms are very comfy and pristine. Very good shower pressure and well balanced bed. The safe is very easy to use and gives a very secure place to leave the wallet and keys when venturing out and about.

title: Modern, comfy & clean room with awesome staff
text: Staff were extremely helpful when we arrived at 12 midnight from out of state. The room was reasonably sized, very clean, very comfy bed and pillows. We travelled with a baby, upon checkout Francesca Gamboa from the front desk served us an extra mile indeed with our luggages with all our baby stuff so we could get our car and load them. Will definitely come back here next time!

title: Great stay
text: Super clean and comfortable room, very friendly staff, great location. Would definitely stay here again. Front desk was very accommodating and kind, especially Francesca. Room was on the smaller side but that’s not something that is important to me especially when you’re hanging in NYC.

title: Made our NYC experience a lot easier!!
text:
Let me start by thanking the staff for their amazing work, a specially Francesca !! She went above and beyond for us, super helpful, and a super fun person, we were happy with our stay, the rooms are clean, but the Location is the winner here ! We were within minutes (Walking!) from all the main NYC attractions! 4min wall to Times Square! A Starbucks just in front of the hotel, which is always great to fuel your morning touristy walk! 
Thank you, and a BIG shout out to Francesca !

title: Good location, good value
text: This hotel is well located near Fifth Avenue and close to Times Square. Very convenient for shopping or going to eat.  The Premier Room with 2 Double Beds is small. It may be normal compared to NYC standards.  The AC worked well. No issues with noise. Front desk team was top notch.  The wifi speed was fine. The ToGo breakfast offering was the same everyday (yogurt, granola bar, OJ, and fruit cup). I would have liked to see them rotate some options (like fresh fruit instead of fruit cup, bagel, muffin or cereal).

title: Lovely Hotel
text: This hotel was perfect for me. Short distance from the heart and all the fun hustle and bustle of Manhattan. Broadway, 42nd Street, Time Square, to Grand Central Station are just a 5 minute walk. But yet the hotel provided a quiet sleep when I need it. The hotel is modern, and bright which made the suite feel spacious enough. The staff was top notch. Francesca at the front desk was amazing during my stay. Always professional with a friendly greeting and warm smile. She's very knowledgeable of New York and helped tremendously to make a smooth and fun trip. She helped me navigate around Manhattan with ease and made some amazing vegan restaurants recommendation. House keeping were very friendly in the morning on my way out to tour NY. Making sure they replenish what I need most in the room, when I get back from my day tour. I loved my stay in Citadines and I will definitely come back to Citadines whenever I'm in Manhattan.

title: Worst water pressure ever
text: Stayed in a lot of hotels in my life, this one was not bad but had the worst water pressure of any hotel I've ever stayed in. If they fixed that, I would have given them the 5 cause the beds were comfortable and the ac was cold!

title: Great Hotel!
text: All of the front desk staff was nice especially Francesca and the gentlemen, both of them always greet us whenever we pass by the lobby, there’s one front desk that doesn’t really greet it’s the woman who speaks Spanish who helped us checked-in. She was able to process our early check-in but with a fee of $50+tax, I was disappointed when I’ve notice and heard the next day that a family of 3 was able to check-in early without paying an early check-in fee and was accommodated right away, it’s unfair that we had to pay for the early check-in fee. Anyways let’s talk about the room, just so you know that this is not a 5 star hotel but I believe this is one of Citadines boutique hotel? (Maybe I’m wrong) but anyways, room is a bit small (of course you’re in NYC, just don’t expect you’re in a luxury hotel) we chose this hotel because time square is just 5 minutes walks and close to Rockefeller, Saks Fifth, Empire State, and Central Park. I would definitely book with this hotel on our next NYC trip, just because it’s nearby the attractions and hotel staff was nice to us. Thank you Francesca, you made us feel welcome every time you see us! Keep up the good work and I would rate your hospitality 10/10 Very Satisfied!

title: Truly the worst hotel ever..
text:
I would recommend this hotel to anyone that 1. loves to get screwed over or 2. wants to have their luggage stolen from them, then have the hotel never give you the time of day and continually brush you off and after 2 months, not fully reimburse you for the $2500 worth of belongings in the stolen luggage. The general manager of this hotel, Elizabeth Ardiles, does not know how to display good customer service or follow company policies, given the company has policies, probably not though. On the morning of March 30th, we walked in at about 9:30 to check in. Elizabeth told us that the hotel had no hot water (??????), so we decided we would leave our luggage at the hotel while we figured out our plan. When we left, she had told us to put our luggage in the lobby wide out in the open and she would deal with it, which she clearly did not for god knows how long because when we came back one of our backpacks was missing. We came back at around 11:00 to check in for one night, as we would switch hotels the next day since they had no hot water. We check in and I PAY, and then she reveals to us that one of our backpacks was not there. Conveniently enough, the camera footage is lost. She sends me off into the street with some random guy that also works there to go look for the backpack as if we will just find it laying on the street. Elizabeth assures me I will be reimbursed and that I should get an email from the higher ups by the end of the current week, it was Tuesday at the time, or the beginning of the next week. This does not happen, and for the next two months I send email after email, text and call Elizabeth for updates, to which all I am told is to “wait until the end of this week” and “I will email [corporate] again to see what’s going on”. I do not believe that any of that happened though. After a month, I am handed to the controller of what seems to be a different hotel? (The Element New York Times Square), Ivan Bonilla. He asks me for my address to send the check to on April 27th and that’s the last I hear from him. I response in 5 minutes. In my response, I also ask for the amount that will be issued on the check. No response. The next week I email again asking if the check had been mailed. No response. Two weeks after that (May 21st) I email, again. I ask in this email for an update (one I feel I am entitled to) on my check, if it had been mailed yet. No response. I finally received a check on May 24th for less than half the amount of the worth of my items. Not to mention, I’m a college student who does school fully online, so not only did this hotel cause me to lose all the items I use for school, but every assignment, note, and document I’ve taken from my college career. 

I think that this was an inside job, and one of the employees at this hotel, if not Elizabeth, took my luggage. There were many cameras in the lobby of this hotel, yet none of the footage was recoverable? What’s the point of the cameras then? Please never stay here. The rooms are insanely small anyways, even for NYC standards, and the night stand in our room wasn’t even level… you could not place anything on it without it falling over.. Save your money and your sanity. And your stuff.. The other hotel that we went to after was the Hilton Garden Inn on 57th and 3rd. Same price, way better. I recommend you shift your travel plans there if you are on the same kind of budget I was.

title: El destino nos regresa!!!
text:
Hace algunos años nos hospedamos ahí cuando tenía otro nombre el hotel. En esta ocasión sin saber que era el mismo hotel, hicimos reservación. Es un hotel con muy buena ubicación, comodidad, atención y presupuesto. 
Muy bien ubicado para llegar a la Gran Central, Time Square, 5ta Av, restaurantes, etc. 
Hablan español, incluye desayuno americano, te apoyan para mejorar los cargos de Fee’s, habitaciones renovadas, staff muy amable…etc.
NYC tiene miles de opciones de hospedaje, pero Citadines es una que vale la pena considerar si estás buscando viajar a Nueva York.

title: Best Hotel Stay In NYC - Top Notch Service
text:
I stayed at the Citadines and have to say I am so impressed by their service. Stephanie from the reception is an asset to Citadines and knows how to deliver a great service to guest. She was knowledgeable, answered my questions promptly and very professional. 

The hotel rooms are comfortable, clean, organized and very fresh. I ended up extending my stay since it the hotel is very accomodating. It is in Midtown so everything is walking distance. 

Recommend Citadines 1000/100. If you end up meeting Stephanie - know you are in the best hands possible for the best guest service & hospitality.

title: Great hotel in the heart of NY
text:
We stayed at the Citadines, we had to visit family and couldn’t stay with other people as we normally would due to Covid. 
The hotel is in great location, quick walking distance to Grand Central or Times Square so easy access to both uptown and downtown. 
We stayed in the suite, while not a luxurious suite, it offered plenty of room and a wall and a door which allows one person to move around if the other person wants to sleep. 
All the staff are friendly and helpful and want to give a thanks to Liz who was especially helpful on our last day.
It was an enjoyable stay and would be happy to stay there again.

title: Married Couple Retreat
text: Citadines Connect was the hotel we booked to celebrate our Anniversary.  We could not have been happier.  From the moment Stephanie checked us in to our last goodbye on Saturday morning we enjoyed nothing but warm hospitality in a clean, comfortable hotel room in one of the most choice spots in midtown.  Directly between Grand Central and Times Square.  We will book here again!

title: itan hay
text: We arrived at the hotel and were received nicely, a manager named Elizabeth has amazing service listening and helpful and advice perfect service, besides the location of the hotel is really great on 5th Avenue, the price is great, the room is tidy and provides a clean toilet and shower, room service comes in the Korena period sometimes  For a stay of 8 nights. In short recommended.  5 stars .

title: Great location clean room
text: The rooms are small but clean.  If you are traveling alone for business and need midtown area this is an excellent location. The rooms are quiet and the staff of Stephanie and Joel were great and very helpful.

title: Great location, comfortable and modern hotel
text: We had a fantastic stay at Citadines.  Our room was clean, nice modern decor, and overall very comfortable.  Great customer service, Francesca at the front desk was very friendly and helpful and later when we called down for extra blankets a very friendly man came up with a bag full of sheets and blankets (more than enough).  The room was also really quiet (which we didn’t expect in NYC).  And it’s hard to beat the location, we were able to do and see so much within walking distance.  Thanks for such a great stay—we will definitely be back!

title: Excellent location, friendly service
text:
I enjoyed my stay at Citadines connect, it’s very close to Times Square and has a great location.
Francesca on the front desk was warm, informative and always happy to help.
The room was very well maintained and comfortable.
I would recommend this hotel.

title: Love it
text: I love the stay , Stephanie was really helpful! I will come back .Everything very clean , and the rooms very modern . Very close to everything! I have problems with the parking but the solve really quick !

title: Beautiful place in the middle of everything
text:
Room is  modern and well clean 
Thanks to 
Stephanie 
Francesca
Joel
For all help from parking to extra blankets and information of where to go and for having a happy and friendly attitude always 
Place is block away from everything in Manhattan I will go a visit again

title: Leisure
text: Nice room very simple and clean. Maybe just have small considerations your guest (ex. I wake up at 10am i called the FD for breakfast but they said twas until 9:30am so i ddnt get one) small consideration will make a guest satisfied. Hi to Francesca she’s very friendly and very nice agent

title: Lovely stay!
text: The decor of the hotel is very beautiful! The staff was very friendly, polite, and attentive. The location is VERY convenient. The view is absolutely amazing! My stay was lovely and relaxing. I highly recommend this place.

title: Francesca was great!
text: The room was a bit smaller than anticipated, but clean, and a comfortable bed. I would have liked having a mini fridge, too. Francesca at the front desk was super friendly, very informative & helpful. She greeted my boyfriend and I every time we returned over our weekend stay.

title: excelente
text: muy buen hotel, habitación cómoda, excelente ubicación a 1,5 cuadras de times square y con muchas atracciones a distancia caminable, muy simple proceso de check in y out, Stephanie amable y atenta a resolver todas tus dudas, recomendado totalmente.

title: Wonderful service
text: Francesca was very hospitable, very friendly, accommodating. Thats service with a smile! I recommend to stay in this hotel to all my friends.  She did an amazing job!  The hotel has a great location. It is clean and comfortable!

title: Excellent check in
text: One of the best check-in experiences I had in a while. Francesca was both courteous and quick with her process and managing my check in and another guest's reservation concern at the same time without hesitation. Room very clean  is clean and modern. She was excellent in her process of getting people to sign up for a membership without sounding too sales pitchy.

title: Excellent
text: We had a great stay!! Great customer service! ❤️ And accessible to almost everything. My husband & I enjoyed our stay. Smooth and easy check in/out. Rooms are clean and sanitized. Definitely be back to this hotel🙂

title: Wonderful Hotel
text:
It was a perfect location, just around the Time Square a few steps from Rockefeller, Empire State Building and 5th Avenue. It was a very nice and clean room, and the staff were so sweet and helpful . I will recommend this hotel to everybody!
Again I would like to say thank you for the all staff and especially for Francesca she was very helpful and professional 
 
Basim Mohamed Zaki

Regards

title: Overall a nice experience!
text: The staff was very welcoming and helpful in every way! The room is just as in the pictures, modern and cozy. There were doing maintenance to the water system which made the water weird for about an hour. Besides that, we had a very pleasant stay.

title: Amazing, I loved the stay. Next time I book a vacation I am going to use Citadines.
text: The room was absolutely clean, amazing shower, plenty of space on the bed and not to mention comfortable. They were attentive, answered any questions, and always ready for support. They gave us everything we could have needed. We may have been at the heart of the city but honestly, the stay in the room was just amazing, we didn't want to leave.

title: Loved it.
text: We had a wonderful stay, the hotel was clean and the staff was amazing 👍🏾👍🏾! The rooms were Cozy and we were walking distance to Grand Central! The hotel is conveniently located in the center of the city. Shout out to Estefania for being so informative and helpful during our stay.

title: Viaje a NYC
text:
La estadía muy acogedora. La mayoría de los recepcionistas hablaban español y la forma de hacer checkin y checkout es muy expedita.
Servicio de WIFI y de televisión muy bueno, existe un pequeño market en el lobby donde puedes escoger snacks y bebestibles con carga del valor a la habitación.

title: Front desk Francesca was amazing!
text: Francesca is a very thoughtful front desker. I booked via Hotel Tonight and it wasn’t in their system yet but she immediately checked me in manually. Later on when my key wasn’t working, she remembered my name and room off the bat.

title: Excellent
text: The staff are wonderful, they were very friendly and kind, the room was cute and modern, the hotel was in the middle of the city. Short walks to many attractions! Times Square was like 7 minutes away, fifth ave is just around the corner. Beautiful!

title: Update entertainment system
text: Would be perfect if we weren’t forced to watch cable tv with no streaming options like other hotels have. The tv doesn’t allow you to hook up a gaming system either which is annoying and outdated being that we are in 2021

title: Great Hotel and location near Times Square
text:
Overall we had a pleasant stay. Staff and service was very good despite the pandemic (they are true essential workers) . Located in the center of tourist attractions and very near transit stops.

Only thing was our bed blanket/comforter still had some stains on them.  And upon request that it be replaced. They did apologize and cleaned our entire room. 

I'm giving 5 stars because they deserve the recognition serving in the front lines. We'll be coming back.

title: Acogedor y cómodo
text: Estuvimos 3 noches y la verdad que la suite que pedimos estuvo impecable, muy acogedora, la pasamos muy bien. El hotel está ubicado en una zona muy céntrica, a tan solo 2 cuadras de Time Square, tienes bancos, farmacias, restaurantes y deli muy cercas. El personal es muy atento y alegre. Definitivamente volveríamos, gracias por todo!

title: Awesome location
text: Awesome location, hablan español, el trato es excelente, el cuarto aunque es pequeño cumple con todo lo necesario para hacer de tu estancia lo mejor y justo en la quinta avenida y a una cuadra de times square a un precio súper accesible

title: Great hotel for your stay!
text: Hi!  I stayed at the Citadines Connect today via Dayuse.  The room was fine - the door opened up to the bathroom immediately LOL.  Once you step in, the bedroom is rather spacious and felt very soft etc.  Desk space was fine.   I did wish they had a refrigerator or a microwave.  Liz was very helpful w/ my questions/issues!

title: Christmas/Birthday Trip
text: The staff was very helpful and kind. Made the stay very easy. Very clean and comfortable! Had everything we needed, close to Bryant park and the Rockefeller Tree, amazing convince for the Christmas season! Will definitely stay again!

title: Great location, dirty bathrooms
text: The location is great and conveniently located to many sights in Manhattan.  Unfortunately, the shower head in my first room was broken and the wash rags visibly had pubic/body hair in them.  After being moved to another room, I found the shower curtain to be stained pink from mildew indicating it hadn’t been washed or changed in a while.

title: Small rooms
text: Small rooms but clean and nice service! The bathroom is comfortable!. The location is great!. The breakfast its OK!. The internet works fine!. The staff is friendly!. The bed is comfortable!. The bad thing is that my room didn’t had any view.

title: Small rooms but good location.
text: Stayed two nights in the King size bedroom.  Tiny room with all amenities provided but felt very industrial and impersonal.  The staff was friendly and helpful, clean and a good location if you want to be near shopping. Our room included daily breakfast but no one informed us or guided us as to how, where and when.

title: Flexible about our booking
text:
We have not even stayed yet, but would like to thank Leslie( Front Office Manager) for being so understanding and flexible about our booking. When we are able to travel we will be booking here and are confident of a great stay.

Thank you so much Leslie.

title: My personal experience at the Citadines Connect Hotel
text: My name is Eddie Galmore and I am a United States Veteran. Throughout my years I have stayed at different hotels and lodging places. Upon my arrival here at Citadines Connect, I was met and helped truly unpretentious by the front desk and it was like this staff that greeted me were  family and was truly there for me unconditionally, and that's how it has been every minute and everyday no matter what the staff, at Citadines wants truly for this experience to be your honest home away from home, comfort, contentment and relaxation. Natalie, Leslie, Evelin and Elva is your extended family at the Citadines Connect and were amazing to me I can not thank them enough.

title: Comfortable and thankful stay!
text: Recently stayed here during Covid as I am an essential worker in the city and as I was a little apprehensive, the staff was so welcoming and made it feel like home for me. Everything was clean and sanitized and the stay was completely comfortable! Highly recommend!

title: Beautiful, Clean, Amazing Staff!
text: My stay at this hotel was everything I could have asked for! I am a nurse that came to help in the city for several weeks and this hotel became my home away from home. It is in a prime location even with places being closed for COVID. The room was updated, clean, and extremely comfortable. I was staying in a big city and I felt really cozy and welcomed each night after returning from my shift. That is all thanks to the amazing staff! They went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable, appreciated, and even safe during the protests happening in the city. I was met with a friendly face every single day. Although I was away from my family I really felt at home. A big shout out to the GM who ALWAYS took the time to check-in on me and made sure I had everything I needed! Thank you Citadines Connect! I will definitely be returning!

title: Clean, comfortable, inviting location
text:
I stayed in this hotel for 6 weeks while working at Elmhurst Hospital. At the time there were only 10-15 guests, all primarily nurses. Upon first impression the room is quiet, clean, and recently updated. Yes, it’s small, but honestly it provided all the space I needed to call home and return to after work. And I gradually bought a plant, some tulips, and made it my cozy own. The staff was beyond friendly and always made me feel welcome. They went above and beyond to provide a special “nurse’s week” thank you. 
I loved the location. Right off of 5th Avenue I could quickly and easily walk to Central Park and see all the inaccessible (due to quarantine closure) sights along the way. I had quick access to the subway to take to work in queens. And even took a long trek up the Brooklyn bridge and WTC. 
Even with the city closed I loved my home away from home. I can’t wait to return when everything is open and you can guarantee I’ll be staying here again! 

ps - the Turkish restaurant next door is terrific and the coffee shop on 46th behind the hotel is super yummy (if you’re not a Starbucks fan). And finally if you want to wander over to the trendy Hell’s Kitchen it’s a 10 minute walk over to 9th. Oh, and you’re right near Times Square. So . . . Truly can’t go wrong!

title: Foi difícil de encontrar e vale muito!
text:
Esse hotel tem um ótimo tamanho e é moderno.
O piso não é de carpete 😀 (confesso que não gosto muito pois me passa impressão de sujo) e o banheiro é descente.
A cama achei bem confortável. A único ponto de observação é que não tem frigobar, mas como estava frio não fez falta. Acho que no verão precisaria. 
E o custo benefício não tem igual pela localização. Está pertinho de tudo.

title: Hôtel impeccable
text:
Hôtel au top.
Très bien situé, au coeur de Manhattan, et à 5 minutes à pied de Times Square et de la Gare Centrale.
Chambre au calme (nous étions au 2ème étage côté parking). Ménage fait tous les jours et chambre très propre. De plus, petit déjeuner simple mais de quoi prendre des forces le matin (fruits, jus de fruits, yaourts, jus d'orange, café et biscuits). En restant 6 jours c'était parfait!
Également personnel accueillant et souriant.
Je recommande.

title: Buena ubicación
text: Lo mejor del hotel es su ubicación, no más de 5 minutos caminando a Time Square. El hotel no tiene muchas habitaciones, solo 5 por planta y tampoco dispone de un comedor donde desayunar, sino que se hace en el mismo hall. El desayuno es muy justito, para comenzar a caminar con algo en el estómago, pero se agradece.  Las habitaciones están bien  y bastante limpias aunque al igual que el cuarto de baño, ningún sitio donde colocar nada. No tiene armarios y por lo tanto no se puede sacar la ropa de la maleta. La cama es cómoda, pero por lo menos mi habitación era bastante ruidosa a cualquiera hora del día o de la noche. El trato con el staff fue agradable y cordial e intentaron solventar con diligencia los típicos problemas en las habitaciones. Lo último a reseñar es que a horas concretas, puedes desesperar a la hora de coger los ascensores.

title: hotel idealement situé
text:
très bon hotel. idéalement situé sur la 5ème avenue, à proximité de Bryant park, de la gare centrale, et du rockefeller center. à 3 min d'une station de métro.
taille de la chambre correcte, propre et confortable.
Petit dej américain correct, manque peut etre d'un peu de variété, si pas de place dans l'espace repas, ne pas hésiter à monter dans sa chambre. 
personnel serviable et possibilité de laisser ses bagages

title: Citadines Connect Fifth Avenue
text: I can’t say enough good about this hotel!  It was the best.  My top priority is cleanliness and this place was sparkling clean.  It was modern and beautiful.  Location was amazing. It was within walking distance of most of our favourite attractions.  Service was great,  staff were friendly and helpful,  kids liked the quick breakfast items,  hotel was quiet for sleeping and rooms had a heater/air conditioner.  Also, lots of great places to eat on the same street.  Bonus,  right next to Time Square.  We highly recommend this hotel, we will stay there every time we come now.

title: Service client aux abonnés absents
text: J'ai réservé en novembre 2019 une chambre premier king room pour 1 semaine fin mai 2020, en tarif prepaid. Problème, ma carte n'a pas été débitée et j'ai dû faire opposition sur ma carte en décembre suite à une fraude. Depuis, impossible d'avoir le service client en ligne pour trouver une solution (je ma fais balader d'un servuce à l'autre), leur seule proposition après 3 mois de mails et appels téléphoniques étant que je leur envoie mon numéro de carte par email + copie recto verso de ma carte!!! Impossible d'avoir l'hôtel et le service client est aux abonnés absents. J'ai pris une réservation classique dans un autre hôtel (plus cher, forcément) pour ne pas être à la rue et en attendant je suis bloquée avec une réservation prepaid non payée que je ne peux pas annuler! J'ai rarement vu un service clients aussi déplorable. Pour une grande chaîne d'hotel, c'est vraiment dommage. D'autant que l'hotel me semblait parfait pour ma semaine à NYC pour la 1ere fois. J'espère que ce message les fera réagir... enfin ...

title: Cosy & Friendly...
text:
The caption above may sound a little odd for a hotel that has 22 floors and 125 rooms, but when in New York, it is all relative, and cosy and friendly Citadines Connect Fifth Avenue New York was.  The hotel is located in the heart of Manhattan, 45th Street between 5th and 6th Avenue and is in close proximity to all the fantastic shopping on 5th and Madison Avenues and to Rockefeller Centre and Radio City. It is a very busy hotel as one would expect, and the small reception/lobby area that also serves as a communal breakfast and breakout area with an estimated max seating capacity of 20 does not make it easy for anyone trying to navigate his/her way around.   

Caitlyn, the fantastic resident manager whom most of us who will come to know and meet at least once during our stay, was especially helpful with jostling and managing my unpredictable schedule and unforeseen changes and went out of her way to assist when the hotel was fully booked on the President's Day weekend. For this I am thankful to her and her entire team.

My room, although basic, is reasonably spacious by New York standards (approx. 17m sq.) and a king size bed fits quite comfortably. There is no wardrobe except for a hanger bar and some shelf space.  Bathroom amenities are of decent quality, and it comes with a full size bathtub, a rarity in a big city hotel. The only drawback is the walls are thin, and there was the cheeky European guest in the adjacent room who stole a couple of puffs in the room. The smoke didn't have to travel very far as there are only 5-6 rooms to a congested floor.  The smoking stopped as soon as management was alerted to it. 

Breakfast is included but only a limited selection of fresh fruits, yoghurt, mini muffins and pastries are served, with freshly brewed coffee and tea. The morning occasion becomes rather stressful as the eating area gets so crowded that I didn't even bother having breakfast one morning. The staffs however do encourage us to take what we need and eat it elsewhere, but that defeats the whole purpose of having a relaxing breakfast when you're on vacation, and, when it's 9 Fahrenheit outside. I would hope that management would seriously consider either upping the spread and the space or perhaps not including it at all. Having an unpleasant breakfast experience will mar any customer’s overall satisfaction.  And if the hotel continues its breakfast offering, please also consider including a hot cereal, especially in winter, that, I’m sure anyone would appreciate. One is not asking for a full English breakfast here.  The Grab and Go (refrigeration) corner in the eating area is a great feature that stocks cold juices, water, fruit snacks and yoghurt and any guest can purchase the items at any time.    

The business space, located on the lower level and though small, serves a useful purpose for urgent printouts.  It is equipped with new 2 new iMacs and a printer.  I had to print a few documents during my stay and to my pleasant surprise, they were free of charge. One gets so used to being charged an arm and leg elsewhere (☹) so this was a really nice touch (😊).  

Notwithstanding, and in spite of a few shortcomings,  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who would like a reasonably priced*, cosy and friendly accommodation in the very heart of a fabulous city that is New York.  

* non-holiday off peak rates.  Holiday rates are comparable with other major hotels in NYC which range $150-$250 for a Premier Room King.  

*****

title: Nice hotel and great location BUT DONT TRUST THE HOTEL TAXI SERVICE
text: Nice hotel and GREAT location. Clean and comfortable rooms and only a short walk away from Rockefeller & Times Square. BUT!!!! Whatever you do, DO NOT take the hotel up on its offer to arrange a driver to the airport for you. Despite reading complaints about these drivers/taxis in the reviews, we still booked one and this was a mistake. So LISTEN TO THE REVIEWS AND GET AN UBER/public transportation to the airport. We agreed upon a price for the ride with the hotel staff and paid part of this price to the hotel, the rest we had to pay to the driver. We asked the hotel twice if this was indeed the total price and even got a receipt, but once we got into the taxi and drove away, it was made VERY clear to us by the driver that the agreed upon price was NOT an option and we would have to pay more - despite having a receipt from the hotel with the ‘total amount’. The entire situation has ‘scam’ written all over it so do yourself a favor and avoid this by arranging your own ride to the airport.

title: Awesome staff and excellent location
text:
The hotel is an excellent location when you go to New York, it's within the vicinity of great attractions. The lobby is a bit crowded but welcoming. Caitlyn is a gem! Her warm smile and hospitality makes us at home. She was able to check us in 3 hours earlier than the usual with the bonus of being in the top floor. Ola was very helpful storing our luggages . Room was more than we expected. Big comfy beds, Extra pillows,  TV decent size lots of channels to choose from. Bathroom plenty of towels.
Caitlyn was able to book us a ride to the airport and surprisingly it was a Limo !!! We couldn't ask for more! Breakfast grab and go was a plus but it could be better with more choices. Will definitely recommend!

title: Excelente
text: Fantástico el hotel.todo limpio, cambian toallas todos los días súper agradable y acogedor. Desayuno bastante bien fruta, yogures, bollería, y por supuesto café con leche. Los empleados del hotel todos fantásticos, en especial la señorita anabel,  evelin,  y roberto. No tengo ninguna queja, súper recomendable

title: Quick trip to NYC.
text: Caitlyn at the front desk is Awesome!! Not only very knowledgeable about NYC, She is patient and kind to all the guest. We decided to stay a second night and called last minute and She was able to find us a room!!

title: Ótima estadia!
text: Hotel com boa localização, limpo e novo. O banheiro é moderno e muito satisfatório. Único ponto que poderia ser melhorado no quarto é a acústica. Quando os hóspedes dos quartos próximos chegam durante a noite, o barulho da conversa pode incomodar um pouco. O café da manhã é satisfatório também. Voltaria com certeza e recomendaria para família e amigos.

title: Super bien placé!!
text:
Situé entre la 5e avenue (a 30m) et la 6eme, entre Grand Central et Time square, l'emplacement est idéal si vous voulez visiter Manhatan. Le petit dejeuner n'est pas continental mais vous aurez de quoi demarrer la journée (du café ou du thé, jus de fruit et des fruits frais, et qqles biscuits). Les chambres sont agréables, calmes si vous n'est pas sur la rue (bon...c'est aussi la ville qui ne dort jamais).
L'accueil est tres agréable et l'equipe est disponible et dynamique.
Bref, si je retourne a NY, je dors au citadine connect 5th avenue.

title: Au top
text:
Les avis que j'ai pu lire avant de partir à NYC parlaient du petit déjeuner. Pour notre part nous avons passé une superbe semaine d'une par les visites et rencontres que nous avons pu faire mais avant tout grâce à cet hôtel.
En effet, il est vraiment très bien situé (1 fois le taxi en 1 semaine sauf pour trajet aéroport > hôtel), le personnel est très gentil et serviable. Notre chambre était comme nous l'attendions, ménage fait chaque jour, linge de SDB et produits présents (ça allège les valises ;-) )
Concernant ce point noir que j'ai pu voir si souvent, ben nous avons trouvé le petit déjeuner très bien, yaourt / gâteaux / fruits / jus de fruit / boissons chaudes le tout pouvant être emporté dans notre chambre ou dans les rues de New-York. Cette dernière option était la notre pouvant ainsi profiter un max de la beauté de NYC tout en déjeunant.

Merci au personnel de cet hôtel qui a joué un grand rôle dans la réussite de notre semaine.

title: Perfect for weekend getaway to the city
text: The staff was wonderful, the room and bathroom was functional, clean and very nice. Bed was super comfortable. It was the perfect location right off 5th avenue to get to everywhere. Would definitely stay here again for the price.

title: Proche Times Square
text:
Bon hotel. Bien situé dans Manhattan. Rien à dire sauf le petit déjeuner un peu léger pour un français : jus de fruit, yaourt, café, et petits gâteaux ; avant une longue journée de marche et visite, nos ados avaient vite faim dans la matinée.
Mais je le recommande quand même.

title: Stanza nello scantinato
text:
Credo che già il titolo da sè possa rendere l’idea della pessima esperienza.
La stanza assegnata si trovava infatti nello scantinato dell’albergo, con finestra finta credo. C’era infatti un pannello rigido che non permetteva di scorgere oltre. Stanza che anziché essere affittata ai clienti, dovrebbe piuttosto fungere da deposito vista la posizione. Colazione praticamente inesistente e ripetitiva. Farebbero più bella figura a toglierla direttamente dall’offerta. Impianto di riscaldamento rumorosissimo, siamo infatti stati costretti a chiuderlo di notte per poter dormire. Uniche note positive: la posizione in pieno centro e attaccata alla metro e la simpatia del personale addetto alle pulizie e del signore addetto al deposito bagagli. Per il resto un disastro.

title: 3* Doesn't Do It Justice
text:
Fantastic hotel, incredible location, brilliant staff. Clean, extremely big and comfortable beds, great tv channels, fully equipped bathrooms. Everything you could hope for in your trip to this fantastic city.

There are only 2 things I would make people aware of:
1. The breakfast is grab n go which works very well for a lot of guests I'm sure but if your heart is set on a sit down, warm breakfast it is not. It's a selection of pastries and fruit with coffee and juice.
2. I read in a few places that they were kitchenette rooms when they are in fact just regular hotel rooms, theres no fridge/stove/microwave etc.

Overall we had an amazing stay, we truly think it should be more than a 3*, it's fantastic value for money and we would definitely return!
Thank you so much to all the staff. 10/10.

title: So comfortable and friendly
